required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Airway Management With Supraglottic Devices in Unruptured Intracranial Aneurysms
clinical_study.official_title: Airway Management With Supraglottic Devices in Unruptured Intracranial Aneurysm Endovascular Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundacion Clinic per a la Recerca Biomédica

clinical_study.source: Fundacion Clinic per a la Recerca Biomédica

brief_summary.textblock: Endovascular techniques for the treatment of intracranial aneurysms are growing.

detailed_description.textblock:
Retrospective analysis of the investigators experience in the last 8 years with the airway management in endovascular therapy for unruptured aneurysms. A total of 206 participants will be included from 2010 to 2018. Airway management (anticipated difficult airway, need for LM repositioning, orotracheal intubation because of failed laryngeal mask insertion, airway complication), intraoperative monitoring, aneurism size and location, intraoperative and perioperative complications will be registered.
Statistics will be compared between groups with t test or x test, as appropriate.

primary_outcome.measure: Security in the use of supraglottic devices in the unruptured intracranial aneurysms.
primary_outcome.description: security; the incidence of adverse events during the procedure and post-procedure will be recorded, also morbidity and mortality in patients managed with supraglottic devices during unruptured aneurysm embolization

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent endovascular treatment for unruptured aneurysm in the past 8 years in our institution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients that underwent endovascular treatment for unruptured aneurysm
Exclusion Criteria:
- ruptured aneurysm

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fundacion Clinic per a la Recerca Biomédica
